title.narrative: Strengthen rice production and developing marketing strategies

description.narrative:
CHAURU is a, young, active primary cooperative specialized in irrigation. Because most farmers grow rice on the irrigated fields CHAURU may easily be mistaken to be rice cooperative. Established in 2003 out of a government Irrigation Scheme CHAURU provides several services to farmers. CHAURU has about 860 members depending on the water provided to grow their crops. CHAURU is an irrigation cooperative. This means the core business is about irrigation, about maintaining the channels and pumps, about having enough water to grow crops. Their member commitment is also derived from being an irrigation cooperative. There is a necessity for famers to work together within CHAURU because if they don’t do so, nobody is getting any water to grow crops. Collaboration with Agriterra aim to increase production and also working on their vision of marketing and processing the rice from its members.
CHAURU is primary cooperative established June 2003 in Chalinze district Coast Region is the rural primary co operative society dealing with rice farming through irrigation. in this first year 2018 of collaboration, Agriterra agreed with CHAURU to have no budget only Advisory mission - development of strategic plan, and training- cooperative governance training and basic financial management.
CHAURU's goal is to improve the member commitment and service provision to members, processing and add value to rice and establishing market links for their rice.
